settings.heading: Stress Eating Feeds on Itself
settings.body:
• Replace mindless eating.
  • Satisfying treat creates real calm with adaptogens.
  • Not a “diet” food, this is for conscious eating & mood support.

settings.quote: It works! It’s a really good way to have a treat in the afternoon without having a candy bar!
settings.author: Cass21

settings.quote: This really works…. notice less looking for something to snack on.
settings.author: Mzzg

settings.headline_text: Boost Your Bev with Stave The Crave

settings.body_text: We kept the sugar out and carbs low. Add a drop of honey or agave if you seek more sweet. Yum!

settings.list_text: You’ll see specks of goodness in your cup. They make this work, as is common with natural functional drinks.

settings.title: Can I use Stave the Crave every day?
settings.summary: Yes. Our formulas are made up of all natural ingredients and can be used for daily support. However, limit yourself to 3 servings daily - these are potent formulas!

settings.title: Can I have Stave the Crave with other supplements or medications?
settings.summary: Our products are all-natural and can be used in conjunction with other Wile products. Please speak to your primary physician before taking Stave the Crave with other medications.

settings.title: What does Stave the Crave taste like?
settings.summary: It's a classic chai flavor but it does have a bit of peppery kick! It's also a bit less sweet than many chai drinks.

settings.title: How do I drink Stave the Crave?
settings.summary: Mix it anything you'd enjoy with chai. We love it in coffee or tea, especially ginger tea. It's tasty in warm milks or with nut butter-based smoothie or vanilla or plain protein powders or even yogurt. It's mixable in plain hot water, but we don't recommend it in cold water.

settings.title: Is there caffeine in Stave the Crave?
settings.summary: No, there is no added caffeine nor any artificial stimulants in this formula. However, we find it leaves us feeling a "good" energy. It's a nice change from slamming another cup of coffee when we're feeling tired or under pressure and want something to keep us going. (That's often when women stress eat.)

settings.title: Are there clinical studies supporting Stave the Crave?
settings.summary:
